title: Social Problem-Solving Simulation Through Complex Discovery Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment using smartphone-based VR simulators. Social problem-solving projects requiring a combination of step-by-step discovery learning and structured explanations

learning_goals: Using the four-stage discovery learning cycle (problem recognition → hypothesis formulation → VR simulation experimentation → result analysis), learners will diagnose community issues with 80% accuracy.
Based on intermediate knowledge states (Phase 1 outcomes), learners will achieve over 70% improvement in a two-stage instructional design (discovery learning + collaborative problem-solving).
Through project-based assessments, learners will present solutions to real-world social problems in three or more concrete implementation steps.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
